alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 4:42AM PST until January 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, except 1 to 2 feet above 7500 feet and 2 to 3 feet above 8500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 100 mph across Sierra ridgelines with gusts to 35 mph in lower elevations. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause tree damage and lead to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be around 9000 feet early this morning, though may drop lower at time in the heavier bands of precipitation. Snow levels will fall to near 7500 feet mid- afternoon, and below 6500 feet this evening.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
